title: Writing in the Galleries: Clay and Creation
short_description: Explore newly installed contemporary ceramics from Korea and Japan through close looking and poetry.
list_description: Explore newly installed contemporary ceramics from Korea and Japan through close looking and poetry.
description:
If a sculpture could sing, what would it sound like? If it could crack open, what would emerge?

Join us in Gallery 135 to explore newly installed contemporary ceramics from Korea and Japan through close looking and poetry. Participants are invited to get creative together, joining museum educators to build a shared poem inspired by these works.

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
